channel.title: Cosine Rule Solver

item.title: Cosine Rule Solver
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Again another prog made for brother, thought id share
answer will be “NaN” if you type it in wrong or if its impossible

import java.lang.Math; import java.util.Scanner;

public class Trig
{

public static void main(String[] args)
{
	System.out.println("(c)Oliver Atkinsons Java Based Cosine Solver\nAll Rights Reserved");
	       Scanner Scan = new Scanner(System.in);
	double c;
	double b;
	double a;
	System.out.print("a = ");
	    a = Scan.nextDouble();
  		System.out.print("b = ");
	    b = Scan.nextDouble();
	System.out.print("Angle C = ");
	    c = Scan.nextDouble();
	double c2 = Math.pow(c,2);
	double b2 = Math.pow(b,2);
	double a2 = Math.pow(a,2);
	double ans = a2 + b2 - (4*a*b*Math.cos(c));
	double ans2 = Math.pow(ans,0.5);
	System.out.println("Answer = " + ans2);
}

}
